title: Erotic horror
html:
Erotic horror

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Erotic horror, alternately called horror erotica or dark erotica, is a term applied to works of fiction in which sensual or sexual imagery are blended with horrific overtones or story elements for the sake of sexual titillation.[1] Horror fiction of this type is most common in literature and film. Erotic horror films are a cornerstone of Spanish horror.[2]

See also[edit]

  • Erotic thriller
  • Monster erotica
    • Dinosaur erotica
  • Ero guro

References[edit]

  1. ^ Sipos, Thomas M. (2014). Horror Film Aesthetics: Creating the Visual Language of Fear. McFarland. p. 27. ISBN 9780786458349.
  2. ^ Benshoff, Harry M. (2014). A Companion to the Horror Film. John Wiley & Sons. p. 380. ISBN 9781118883495.

Further reading[edit]

  • Bradley, Linda, Love and Death in the American Car: Stephen King's auto-Erotic Horror
